      • init

        public void init()

      • dispose

        public void dispose()

      • newGame

        public void newGame(Game game)
        Start a new game. Note that no listeners will be notified nor callbacks invoked at the start of the first turn when the game begins; however, after the first look action, turn listeners will be called.
        Parameters:
        game - game to start

      • loadGame

        public void loadGame(WorldState worldState)
        Resume a game given a restored WorldState. While the world model graph will be as it was when the game was saved, the UI may be slightly different (no images, and definitely no scrollback in the main text area).
        Parameters:
        worldState - WorldState to restore

      • movePlayer

        public void movePlayer(Room toRoom)
        Moves the player to a destination room. All appropriate listeners will be notified, and one of them may cancel this move.
        Parameters:
        toRoom - the room to which the player should move.

      • moveEntity

        public void moveEntity(Entity e,
              Room toRoom)
        Moves an entity to a room. The entity can currently reside in a room, in player inventory, or nowhere.
        Parameters:
        e - entity to move
        toRoom - destination room, or null if the entity should be removed from the game world

      • takeEntity

        public void takeEntity(Entity e)
        Takes an entity (i.e. moves an entity to the player inventory).
        Parameters:
        e - entity to take

      • isInInventory

        public boolean isInInventory(Entity e)
        Returns true if the given entity is in the player inventory.

      • isWorn

        public boolean isWorn(Entity e)
        Returns true if the entity is being worn by the player

      • setWorn

        public boolean setWorn(Entity e,
              boolean wear)
        Sets whether an entity is worn by the player. If it is already equipped, it will be unequipped.
        Parameters:
        e - entity to wear
        wear - whether the player should wear the entity. If true, and the given entity is in the player inventory and is wearable, the player will wear it.
        Returns:
        true if the operation succeeded

      • isEquipped

        public boolean isEquipped(Entity e)
        Returns true if the entity is equipped by the player

      • setEquipped

        public boolean setEquipped(Entity e,
                  boolean equip)
        Sets whether an entity is equipped by the player. If it is worn, it will be taken off first.
        Parameters:
        e - entity to equip
        equip - whether the player should equip the entity. If true, and the given entity is in the player inventory and is equippable, the player will equip it.
        Returns:
        true if the operation succeeded

      • aboutMenuClicked

        Called by the UI when the user selects the "About..." menu item.

      • lookCommand

        public void lookCommand()
        Called by the UI when the user clicks "Look", or when the player moves rooms

      • queueLookText

        public void queueLookText(String text,
                 boolean paragraph)
        Adds text to be shown during the next look action.
        Parameters:
        text - text to show
        paragraph - if true, the text will be shown in its own paragraph; if false, it will be shown along with any other text that didn't request a separate paragraph

      • waitCommand

        public void waitCommand()
        Called by the UI when the user clicks "Wait"

      • entityActionSelected

        public void entityActionSelected(String action)
        Called by the UI when the user clicks an action button (or selects an action from the combo box when there are many actions)

      • undoCheckpoint

        public void undoCheckpoint()
        Creates an undo checkpoint to which the user can return by invoking undo.

        This is automatically called when

        • a room exit is selected
        • an entity action is selected
        • a look command is invoked
        • a wait command is invoked
        but games can call it at any point that would be reasonable if they're going to do something potentially non-recoverable, like killing the player or moving him to Hades.

        On a 2.13Ghz i3 from 2010 with slow RAM, checkpointing Cloak of Darkness takes about 1.5ms. So for a huge game on an old machine, turning off undo might be something to consider.

      • entitySelected

        public void entitySelected(Entity e)
        Called by the UI to indicate that the user selected an entity in the lists.
        Parameters:
        e - entity selected, or null if no entity selected

      • entityChanged

        public void entityChanged(Entity e)
        May be called to indicate that the given entity's state has changed in such a way that the UI may need to be refreshed.
        Parameters:
        e - entity that has changed

      • roomChanged

        public void roomChanged(Room r)
        Called when a room's internal state changes in such a way that the UI may have to be updated to reflect the change.
        Parameters:
        r - room that has changed

      • isAlwaysLook

        public boolean isAlwaysLook()
        See Also:
        setAlwaysLook(boolean)

      • addGameActionListener

        public void addGameActionListener(GameActionListener l)
        Adds a GameActionListener to be called when a game action is processed. If the listener's GameActionListener.processAction(String, Entity, boolean) method returns true, further action processing will be bypassed.

        Listeners are added to the front of our list, and thus the most recently added listener will be notified before previously added listeners.

        Parameters:
        l - listener to add

      • removeGameActionListener

        public void removeGameActionListener(GameActionListener l)
        Removes a GameActionListener from the action notification list.
        Parameters:
        l - listener to remove

      • addPlayerMovementListener

        public void addPlayerMovementListener(PlayerMovementListener l)
        Adds a PlayerMovementListener to be called when the player moves. The listener may return true from its PlayerMovementListener.playerMove(com.illcode.meterman.Room, com.illcode.meterman.Room, boolean) method to halt further movement processing.

        Listeners are added to the front of our list, and thus the most recently added listener will be notified before previously added listeners.

        Parameters:
        l - listener to add

      • removePlayerMovementListener

        public void removePlayerMovementListener(PlayerMovementListener l)
        Removes a PlayerMovementListener from the before-movement notification list.
        Parameters:
        l - listener to remove

      • addTurnListener

        public void addTurnListener(TurnListener l)
        Adds a TurnListener to be notified when the turn cycles to the next.

        Listeners are added to the front of our list, and thus the most recently added listener will be notified before previously added listeners.

        Parameters:
        l - listener to add

      • removeTurnListener

        public void removeTurnListener(TurnListener l)
        Removes a TurnListener from the turn-cycle notification list.
        Parameters:
        l - listener to remove
